author: dkrich
body: It’s a simple trend following method similar to a MA but you basically just measure the Friday closing price and when it’s 4% or lower from any prior Friday closing high it’s a sell, 4% or higher from any prior Friday closing low it’s a buy. This is the first week in months that it’s actually trended down enough for long enough to flip to a sell but because the market reversed higher today people are talking about a bottom

author: blueberrydanishguy
body: When jack ma is done sucking dick of all Chinese.

author: Warren_Guh_Buffet
body: Dude BABA was Xi trying to screaw Ma. It had nothing to do with America or politics, dude stop with the conspiracy theories. BABA being a $150 stock today is also because of uncertainty. No one in Wallstreet knows if Xi will simply break up the company. Wallstreet  again could care less about politics, you call me naive yet you reference YouTube as a place where you think anti Chinese sentiment is driving the equities markets. Are you listening to yourself? Wallstreet doesn't care what some random Youtuber with 200 subs feels about China. It's all about earnings reports and going through them with a fine tooth comb. However when a good company like BABA is being attacked by a whole ass country, smart money gets out and waits to see what shoe will drop next. No amount of great earnings reports can combat Xi deciding to simply shut down BABA. As far as you not wanting Chinese stocks in Western markets, be careful what you wish for, the only reason BABA's market cap is what it is today is because of Western money. If all Chinese stocks get delisted, they lose 95% of their value instantly. China alone will not be able to keep BABA's MC $500 bil+

body: MA up 4% and still below the 200 DMA

author: aero_kitten
body: You can use any MA you want, depending on what conclusion you prefer.

author: xavier8100
body: Engrish not ma furst languaee

author: option-trader
body: Oh, it'll definitely be difficult, but the trend since the start of September has been down and being held down by its 10 and 20-day ma. Right now, investors are selling every rally. $420 would be a stopping point, but if Spy was going to go for it, then $412 would be the ultimate target for this drop. That'll reset a lot of stocks and create the buying opportunity to take this to record levels.

author: Kindread21
body:
Don't have any similar experience to confirm with, but intuitively I would guess a platform made to cater to international customers should avoid these kind of issues. Maybe try something like InteractiveBrokers?

Or if you can open a Visa or Mastercard against your bank account you could try something like eToro, which accepts credit card payments (although by default if you draw out it will pay back into the source account, you would have to contact customer support to arrange withdrawals, on each withdrawal, to a different account).
